div.p: REVEREND a title of refpect given to eccleτ fiaſtics.—The religious abroad are called reverend fathers, and abbeſſes, prioreſſes, &c« reverend mothers. In England, biſhops are right reverend, and archbiſhops τnofi reverend. In France, before the Revolution, their biſhops, archbiſhopa, and abbots, were .all alike mofi reverend. In Scotland the clergy individually are reverend, a ſynod is very reverend, .and the general affembly is venerable.
